Award.AwardTitle: Midwestern Workshop on Asymptotic Analysis; Bloomington, Indiana; October 10-11th, 2015
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for the Midwestern Workshop on Asymptotic Analysis, to be held at Indiana University-Bloomington October 10-11, 2015, in Bloomington, Indiana.

The conference will focus on a variety of subfields that are active pursued in the study of analysis, such as several complex variables, approximation theory, mathematical physics (e.g. Schrodinger operators), and the like. This award gives early career mathematicians and/or non-funded mathematicians an opportunity to participate at the conference. The organizer plans outreach to make this funding opportunity known to target groups. More information is available through http://math.iupui.edu/~maxyatts/workshop/

POR.DRECONTENT:
Our goal of the Midwestern Workshop on Asymptotic Analysis (MWAA) in 2015 was to foster cooperation among mathematicians in certain areas of analysis represented in the midwest. A major goal was to expose attending graduate students to these areas. We had 12 PhD students and 7 post-docs who attended and profited from the experience. Five of the post-docs delivered talks (there were 14 talks altogether). Moreover, three of the speakers were female, adding to the diversity of our workshop.

The success of MWAA 2015 led to continued workshops in 2016 and 2017. The addition of new participants as well as continued attendace from MWAA 2015 participants illustrates the success of our goal to encourage cooperation among mathematicians in analysis.

Moreover, the remaining funds from MWAA 2015 were utilized in two very important ways. First of all, some money was used to cover the travel and lodging expenses of a research visit of a female post-doc and a PhD student to Indiana University. In addition, five Indiana University PhD students had their travel and lodging paid by this grant to attend MWAA 2017. This helped contribute to the success of our most recent MWAA meeting and we anticipate this success and collaboration will continue in the future.
